markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 359 4.0 **Tradition** [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) --- You request a direct intercession from the natural world. Nature always refuses unnatural requests and might grant a different request (potentially more powerful or better fitting its character) than the one you asked for. A _primal phenomenon_ spell can do any of the following things.
  • Duplicate any spell from the [primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) list of 9th level or lower to which you have access.
  • Duplicate any spell from another spell list of 7th level or lower. It must be common or you must have access.
  • Produce any effect whose power level is in line with the above effects.
  • Reverse certain effects that refer to the [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377) spell.
At the GM's discretion, you can try to use _primal phenomenon_ to produce greater effects than these, but doing so may be dangerous, or the spell may have only a partial effect.
name: Primal Phenomenon

summary_markdown: Request for nature to duplicate primal spells.
text: Primal Phenomenon Source Core Rulebook pg. 359 4.0 Tradition Primal Cast Three Actions material, somatic, verbal --- You request a direct intercession from the natural world. Nature always refuses unnatural requests and might grant a different request (potentially more powerful or better fitting its character) than the one you asked for. A primal phenomenon spell can do any of the following things. Duplicate any spell from the primal list of 9th level or lower to which you have access. Duplicate any spell from another spell list of 7th level or lower. It must be common or you must have access. Produce any effect whose power level is in line with the above effects. Reverse certain effects that refer to the wish spell. At the GM's discretion, you can try to use primal phenomenon to produce greater effects than these, but doing so may be dangerous, or the spell may have only a partial effect.
